required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neuro-Ox 2018: Assessment of Cerebral Oxygenation Under Three Clinically Relevant Conditions
clinical_study.official_title: Neuro-Ox 2018: Assessment of Cerebral Oxygenation Under Three Clinically Relevant Conditions

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective observational study, consisting of 3 substudies carried out during elective neurosurgery under general anaesthesia. Each participant will take part in all 3 substudies. First, the capability of Near Infra Red Spectroscopy (NIRS) to measure the brain oxygenation is examined. A NIRS-electrode is placed on forehead skin, on the skull, and on dura. Secondly, a small dose of Phenylephrine is given, and the brain oxygenation is measured by a Clark-electrode and a NIRS-electrode, to see how Phenylephrine affects these measurements. In the third substudy, the brain oxygenations' (NIRS and Licox) response to an inspired oxygen fraction of 0.30 vs. 0.80 is investigated.

primary_outcome.description: Difference in ScO2 between dura and skin (Primary analysis for substudy 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: PBrO2 (Partial pressure of brain tissue oxygen)
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral oxygenation, measured by a Clark-electrode (Licox (R)) (Primary outcome measure for substudy 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: PBrO2 (Partial pressure of brain tissue oxygen)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 'Normoxia' is induced with FiO2 = 0.30 for 5 minutes, and then changed to 'Hyperoxia' with FiO2 = 0.80 for the subsequent 5 minutes, while registering the Licox-signal.
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebral oxygenation during inspired oxygen fraction 0.80 vs. 0.30 (Primary outcome for substudy 3)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements will be performed as the surgeon exposes the skull.
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in ScO2 between dura and skull, and between skull and skin (this will be the secondary analyses of substudy 1)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: NIRS signal is obtained continuously during the Phenylephrine intervention
secondary_outcome.description: NIRS-signal during Phenylephrine intervention (this will be the secondary outcome of substudy 2)

arm_group.arm_group_label: One strategy for all enrolled patients:
arm_group.description: All patients will participate in three substudies, in which they also act as controls, with exposure to the same three interventions: 1) NIRS-measurement on skin, skull and dura, 2) Phenylephrine 0.1 mg iv., and 3) inspired oxygen fraction of 0.3 vs. 0.8

intervention.intervention_name: NIRS measurements on skin, skull and dura
intervention.description: During a neurosurgical procedure, we will measure the brain oxygenation with a NIRS-electrode, first on forehead skin, then on the skull and finally directly on dura.
intervention.arm_group_label: One strategy for all enrolled patients:

intervention.description: With a Clark-electrode (Licox(R)) in the white matter and a NIRS-electrode on the forehead skin, we will give a small dose (0.1 mg iv.) Phenylephrine.
intervention.arm_group_label: One strategy for all enrolled patients:

intervention.description: By the end of the neurosurgical procedure, still with a Clark-electrode in the white matter and a NIRS-electrode on forehead skin, we will change the inspired oxygen fraction from 0.3 to 0.8.
intervention.arm_group_label: One strategy for all enrolled patients:

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult (>18 years) patients
- Elective craniotomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Repeat craniotomy
- Preoperative hypotension (defined as systolic blood pressure below 110 mmHg)
- Preoperative hypoxia (defined as peripheral oxygen saturation (SpO2) < 90% without oxygen supplementation before surgery)
- No negative pregnancy test for women <50 years.
